title: The Space Race
key_facts: A 20th-century competition between two Cold War rivals, the Soviet Union (USSR) and the United States (US), to achieve firsts in spaceflight capability.
Began with the Soviet launch of Sputnik 1 in 1957.
Peaked with the US Apollo 11 Moon landing in 1969.
Concluded with the joint Apollo-Soyuz Test Project in 1975.
causes: The Cold War geopolitical rivalry and the need to demonstrate technological and ideological superiority.
Military interest in rocket technology for intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs).
National pride and the propaganda value of scientific achievements.
outcome: US victory in landing humans on the Moon.
Rapid advancement in aerospace technology, telecommunications, and computer science.
Eventually led to international cooperation in space (ISS).

figures.name: Yuri Gagarin
figures.significance: First human to journey into outer space.

figures.name: John F. Kennedy
figures.significance: Committed the US to landing a man on the Moon within the decade.

figures.name: Sergei Korolev
figures.significance: Mastermind behind the early Soviet space successes (Sputnik, Vostok).

figures.name: Wernher von Braun
figures.significance: Developed the Saturn V rocket that took Apollo to the Moon.

impacts: Creation of NASA and a massive boost to STEM education.
Development of satellite technology for weather, communications, and GPS.
Cultural impact inspiring science fiction and a sense of global unity (Earthrise photo).
sources: Cadbury, D. (2006). Space Race: The Epic Battle Between America and the Soviet Union.
